abstract.text: Explore the platforms, packaging, OS versions, and device configurations for Network Extension provider deployment.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Network Extension providers extend the networking stack in various ways.  You might implement a custom VPN protocol with a packet tunnel provider, or add a content filter provider as part of a parental control app.  Network Extension supports many different provider types and each type has different deployment requirements.  The tables below summarise these requirements for each provider type.
The Mac Catalyst platform refers to a provider embedded in a Mac Catalyst app running on Mac.  For more information, see
The iOS Apps on Mac platform refers to a provider embedded in an iOS app running on an Apple silicon Mac.  For more information, see

inlineContent.overridingTitle: Running your iOS apps in macOS

overridingTitleInlineContent.text: Running your iOS apps in macOS

inlineContent.text: On macOS most Network Extension provider types can be packaged as either an app extension or a system extension.  App extensions run in a user context; if the user logs out, the provider is terminated.  System extensions run in a global context, completely independent of the logged in user.
If a macOS row does not mention the “App Store only” restriction, the provider supports both App Store distribution and independent distribution using Developer ID signing.
For more information about using the Network Extension framework as a whole, see
When building a packet tunnel provider, use the following table to plan your deployment:

abstract.text: A Boolean value that indicates whether the app can request or revoke authorization to provide parental controls.
Requests authorization to provide parental controls for a child.
Requests authorization to provide parental controls for a child or individual.
Customize and extend core networking features.
Implement a VPN client for a flow-oriented, custom VPN protocol.
Create an on-device network content filter.
Create an on-device DNS proxy using a custom protocol.
Provide functionality similar to Apple Push Notification Service when access to the wider internet is unavailable.
Implement a VPN client for a packet-oriented, custom VPN protocol.
Create a version of your iPad app that users can run on a Mac device.
Configure your target to include and customize capabilities that provide access to Apple’s app services.
Learn about specific development topics through these in-depth technical articles.

about use cases that are not supported.
